DATA.description: Allows to read Document master data, aggregated elements (e.g. changes of status protocol)..
DATA.name: Documents: Read Master Data

DATA.description: Allows to write (create, copy, modify, delete) Document master data and aggregated elements.
DATA.name: Documents: Write Master Data

DATA.description: Allows to categorise Documents. The categorisation of a Document determines e.g. the Document's Object Lifecycle and Access Rights. It is also configurable to define default categories depending on the file type of a Document.
DATA.name: Documents: Categorise

DATA.description: Allows to change the status of Documents.
DATA.name: Documents: Change of Status

DATA.description: Allows to create Documents from Templates.
DATA.name: Documents: Create from Template

DATA.description: Allows to import Files to Documents
DATA.name: Documents: Import

DATA.description: Allows to edit Documents (inclusive lock/unlock mechanisms) by directly invoking a Document's application and using a comfortable save-to-server dialogue to store any changes.
DATA.name: Documents: Edit

DATA.description: Allows to remember a Document to be opened in the CAD System
DATA.name: Documents: Mark for CAD

DATA.description: Allows to use the Platform's Batch Operation functionality for e.g. the change of status for multiple documents.
DATA.name: Documents: Batch Operations

DATA.description: Allows to hierarchically structure Documents e.g. assembly and components or mail and attachements. The possibility to read the structure is given by Featre DOCUMENTS 001.
DATA.name: Documents: Hierarchically Structure

DATA.description: Allows to maintain the catalog Scale used/referenced by Document objects/master data
DATA.name: Documents: Write Scale Catalog

DATA.description: Allows to define exceptional access rights for Documents
DATA.name: Documents: Define Eceptional Access Rights

DATA.description: Allows to maintain the catalogs needed for Document Changes
DATA.name: Documents: Write ECM Catalogs

DATA.description: Allows access to the documents Web UI
DATA.name: Documents: Web UI
